description.p: SpeedyNote is a fast, open-source note-taking application designed for stylus users who need iPad-quality annotation on budget hardware. Built with native C++ and Qt, it delivers 360Hz stylus input on hardware as modest as an Intel Celeron N4000 at 1.1GHz â€” with no Electron bloat.

Annotate PDFs with pressure-sensitive inking tools including pen, marker, and highlighter, all rendered as vector strokes that zoom infinitely without pixelation. Organize your work with multi-layer editing, paged notebooks, or infinite edgeless canvases with lazy-loading tiles.

ul.li: Instant PDF loading with clickable internal links and outline navigation
Multi-layer editing with add, delete, reorder, and merge operations
Touch gestures: two-finger pan, pinch-to-zoom, and palm rejection
Cross-platform note sharing via .snbx notebook packages
Powerful command-line interface for batch PDF export and notebook management
Multi-tab editing to work on multiple documents simultaneously
Auto-save so you never lose work
New batch delete feature in the launcher
Improved the viewport scrolling performance on low-end devices
Optimized the stroke creation delay on low-end devices
Changed to a new .SVG icon on all platforms
Fixed tab switching causing jump to last page
Fixed PDF internal links broken on some versions
Fixed PDF text search highlight misalignment with inserted pages
Fixed starred view staying empty on first use
Migrated exclusively to MuPDF for all PDF operations, resolving library conflicts with Poppler

description.p: Major update with PDF text search, batch export to PDF and .snbx, command-line interface, and system notifications.
